trans-unit.source: JDBC Package for Connected Device Configuration/Foundation Profile (JSR 169)

seg-source.mrk: JDBC Package for Connected Device Configuration/Foundation Profile (JSR 169)

target.mrk: JDBC Package for Connected Device Configuration/Foundation Profile (JSR 169)

seg-source.mrk: JSR 169 features

target.mrk: JSR 169 features

seg-source.mrk: support for

target.mrk: support for

trans-unit.source: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> supports the JDBC API defined for the Connected Device Configuration/Foundation Profile, also known as JSR 169. The features supported are a subset of the JDBC 3.0 specification. Support for JSR 169 is limited to the embedded driver. <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> does not support using the Network Server under JSR 169.

seg-source.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> supports the JDBC API defined for the Connected Device Configuration/Foundation Profile, also known as JSR 169.
The features supported are a subset of the JDBC 3.0 specification.
Support for JSR 169 is limited to the embedded driver.
<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> does not support using the Network Server under JSR 169.

target.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> supports the JDBC API defined for the Connected Device Configuration/Foundation Profile, also known as JSR 169.
The features supported are a subset of the JDBC 3.0 specification.
Support for JSR 169 is limited to the embedded driver.
<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> does not support using the Network Server under JSR 169.

trans-unit.source: To obtain a connection using JSR 169, use the <codeph>org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedSimpleDataSource</codeph> class. This class is identical in implementation to the <codeph>org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedDataSource</codeph> class. See the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for information on using the properties of the <codeph>org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedDataSource</codeph> class.

seg-source.mrk: To obtain a connection using JSR 169, use the <codeph>org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedSimpleDataSource</codeph> class.
This class is identical in implementation to the <codeph>org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedDataSource</codeph> class.
See the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for information on using the properties of the <codeph>org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedDataSource</codeph> class.

target.mrk: To obtain a connection using JSR 169, use the <codeph>org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedSimpleDataSource</codeph> class.
This class is identical in implementation to the <codeph>org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedDataSource</codeph> class.
See the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for information on using the properties of the <codeph>org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedDataSource</codeph> class.

trans-unit.source: JSR 169 and its <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> implementation have the following limitations:

seg-source.mrk: JSR 169 and its <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> implementation have the following limitations:

target.mrk: JSR 169 and its <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> implementation have the following limitations:

trans-unit.source: Applications must get and set <codeph>DECIMAL</codeph> values using alternate JDBC <codeph>getXXX</codeph> and <codeph>setXXX</codeph> methods, such as <codeph>getString()</codeph> and <codeph>setString()</codeph>. Any alternate method that works against a DECIMAL type with JDBC 3.0 will work in JSR 169.

seg-source.mrk: Applications must get and set <codeph>DECIMAL</codeph> values using alternate JDBC <codeph>getXXX</codeph> and <codeph>setXXX</codeph> methods, such as <codeph>getString()</codeph> and <codeph>setString()</codeph>.
Any alternate method that works against a DECIMAL type with JDBC 3.0 will work in JSR 169.

target.mrk: Applications must get and set <codeph>DECIMAL</codeph> values using alternate JDBC <codeph>getXXX</codeph> and <codeph>setXXX</codeph> methods, such as <codeph>getString()</codeph> and <codeph>setString()</codeph>.
Any alternate method that works against a DECIMAL type with JDBC 3.0 will work in JSR 169.

trans-unit.source: The XML data type is not supported, but an application can retrieve, update, query, or otherwise access an XML data value if it has classes for a JAXP parser and for Xalan in the classpath. <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> issues an error if either the parser or Xalan is not found. In some situations, you may need to take steps to place the parser and Xalan in your classpath. See "XML data types and operators" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for details.

seg-source.mrk: The XML data type is not supported, but an application can retrieve, update, query, or otherwise access an XML data value if it has classes for a JAXP parser and for Xalan in the classpath.
<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> issues an error if either the parser or Xalan is not found.
In some situations, you may need to take steps to place the parser and Xalan in your classpath.
See "XML data types and operators" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for details.

target.mrk: The XML data type is not supported, but an application can retrieve, update, query, or otherwise access an XML data value if it has classes for a JAXP parser and for Xalan in the classpath.
<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> issues an error if either the parser or Xalan is not found.
In some situations, you may need to take steps to place the parser and Xalan in your classpath.
See "XML data types and operators" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for details.

trans-unit.source: Java functions and procedures that use server-side JDBC, that is, routines declared with <codeph>CONTAINS SQL</codeph>, <codeph>READS SQL DATA</codeph>, or <codeph>MODIFIES SQL DATA</codeph> clauses

seg-source.mrk: Java functions and procedures that use server-side JDBC, that is, routines declared with <codeph>CONTAINS SQL</codeph>, <codeph>READS SQL DATA</codeph>, or <codeph>MODIFIES SQL DATA</codeph> clauses

target.mrk: Java functions and procedures that use server-side JDBC, that is, routines declared with <codeph>CONTAINS SQL</codeph>, <codeph>READS SQL DATA</codeph>, or <codeph>MODIFIES SQL DATA</codeph> clauses

trans-unit.source: The <codeph>DriverManager</codeph> interface (this means that you cannot use the <codeph>DriverManager.getConnection</codeph> method to obtain a connection but must use the <codeph>org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedSimpleDataSource</codeph> class instead)

seg-source.mrk: The <codeph>DriverManager</codeph> interface (this means that you cannot use the <codeph>DriverManager.getConnection</codeph> method to obtain a connection but must use the <codeph>org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedSimpleDataSource</codeph> class instead)

target.mrk: The <codeph>DriverManager</codeph> interface (this means that you cannot use the <codeph>DriverManager.getConnection</codeph> method to obtain a connection but must use the <codeph>org.apache.derby.jdbc.EmbeddedSimpleDataSource</codeph> class instead)

trans-unit.source: The standard URL used to obtain a connection, <codeph>jdbc:default:connection</codeph> (a runtime error may occur if the routine tries to obtain a connection using <codeph>jdbc:default:connection</codeph>)

seg-source.mrk: The standard URL used to obtain a connection, <codeph>jdbc:default:connection</codeph> (a runtime error may occur if the routine tries to obtain a connection using <codeph>jdbc:default:connection</codeph>)
